perturbation.original_text: Application Provider will not serve advertising on the Co-Branded Application that (i) violates any law, rule, or regulation, (ii) relates to pornography, gaming, tobacco, or alcohol, (iii) is the subject of a claim to trademark, trade name, service mark, or other proprietary rights, or Excite@Home may request removal of any such advertising from the Co-Branded Application, and Application Provider shall remove any such advertising within twenty-four (24) hours of receipt of any such written request.
perturbation.changed_text: Application Provider will not serve advertising on the Co-Branded Application that (ii) relates to pornography, gaming, tobacco, or alcohol, (iii) is the subject of a claim to trademark, trade name, service mark, or other proprietary rights, or Excite@Home may request removal of any such advertising from the Co-Branded Application, and Application Provider shall remove any such advertising within twenty-four (24) hours of receipt of any such written request.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the prohibition of advertising that '(i) violates any law, rule, or regulation,' the contract now permits advertisements that may break the law, violating consumer protection laws related to false advertising and deceptive practices. The contract creates a legal risk by omission.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Various state and federal laws prohibiting false advertising and deceptive trade practices.

perturbation.original_text:
Ownership
          i)   The operation of the Co-Branded Application will permit the
               collection of Payment-Eligible User Data.
          ii)  Payment-Eligible URS User Data, Superset Data, and Shopping
               Category Data collected through the operation of the Co-Branded
               Application will be jointly owned by the parties. The parties'
               respective ownership shall be subject to the restrictions set
               forth in this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
Ownership
          i)   The operation of the Co-Branded Application will permit the
               collection of Payment-Eligible User Data.
          ii)  Payment-Eligible URS User Data, Superset Data, and Shopping
               Category Data collected through the operation of the Co-Branded
               Application will be jointly owned by the parties.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the sentence 'The parties' respective ownership shall be subject to the restrictions set forth in this Agreement', there is no limitation on how the user data collected can be used. This creates a legal contradiction with privacy laws such as CPRA, which regulate the collection, use, and sharing of personal information.

perturbation.original_text:
The collection, storage, and usage of all classes of
            Payment-Eligible User Data shall comply with Excite@Home's
            then-current security and privacy guidelines.
perturbation.changed_text:
The collection, storage, and usage of all classes of
            Payment-Eligible User Data shall
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the text 'comply with Excite@Home's then-current security and privacy guidelines', the contract now has no provision for data security and privacy. This opens up the company to a breach of consumer data protection laws such as GDPR, CCPA, and CPRA which require reasonable security measures to protect personal information.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA)
